Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2011 07:19PM Kimberly1961 wrote: Blondelawyer - Yes, I had BMX and have had 4 drains in for 24 days now.  Sheesh.  I am also having that nerve regeneration thing going on since about 2 weeks post op.  Weird because it's more achy and tender than it was immediately after surgery.  It was pretty darm numb there for a while.  I do not like going out in public with the drains but would rather have drains than lymphedema so I am trying to be patient.
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 01:45PM Kimberly1961 wrote: Cycle-path - Thanks for link to exercises.  Had DMX and one side has full range of motion but the other has a cord feeling in the arm and stuck, almost 5 weeks out.  I had my drains in so long I was afraid to push any exercise for fear of irritation and never getting the drains out (4+ weeks for me).  Surgeon says give it 8 weeks of increased activity and if still problems, then therapy. S Stayton - I had no problem with port insertion, but my nerves were regenerating at that point from breast surgery, so actually the port was probably less sensitive than the rest of the chest.  Compared to the breast surgery, the port was a breeze for me, but it's different for everybody.
Posts.Title: Question about arm after surgery SStayton Kimberly1961

Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed- MerryChristmas (sarcastic) smethot Kimberly1965

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2012 11:52PM Kimberly1965 wrote: Thanks Melissa119 your story sounds alot like mine.  the waiting is agonizing for sure. They say if I don't need chemo before I have sugery I will more than likely have a double mastectomy Jan 8th or 10th. unless something on t6he scans come back bad. I have ups and downs.  my son turns 21 on the 8th so he said do it then mom. get that alien out of you. just wondering how many people have a lump in arm pit too that is very sore?  its been there a while and I agree with theothers every new pain or current pain i think its the cancer eating away.  I will say my right breast is bigger. Like its starting to swell. The alien does feel bigger but could be where the biopsy was done.  from what I understand they are going to test the lymp nodes at time of surgery so he only have to take out the ones affected.   Hoping he doesn't want to do it before since that would be a longer wait. When you are told its very aggressive and Im going on vacation tomorrow in the same sentence from the surgeon it's a little nevere racking ans well as fight insurance for other test.  but as far as I know its all done and just waiting on the rest of the results so they can  get a game plan. smethot I understand how you feel totally.  We will get through this together.  I honestly have been throught this with family and friends but its a whole new ball game when its you.  Also how did I loose control over my life in a 2 second span? it is upside down and sideways.. As much as I love my three kids and 2 grandkids and husband I truely feel this is me now. I cant do this for them. time to be selfish for a change and do it for me. I need control..
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed- MerryChristmas (sarcastic) smethot Kimberly1965

Everything on hold until after the holidays. I've had all the scans so I will see how that goes. I'm 47. Just scared because they say its aggressive and I have a lung nodule that has grown. I understand how you feel.
